definition[0]: a leveraged company is financed by a high level of borrowing in relation to its SHARE CAPITAL (=the money it has from selling its shares)
example[0]: The company is profitable even though it is leveraged much more than most small businesses.
example[1]: It has carried a more heavily leveraged balance sheet than most other oil companies, with debt making up about 47% of its overall capital.
definition[1]: a deal etc in which borrowed money is used by the buyer to pay for something
example[2]: The market for bank loans for leveraged transactions has grown weak.
